title: As a User, I want to view an existing Winter League Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN a player already has an existing Winter League Requests
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking on the transaction in a player's Winter League History widget
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window
AND Browser tab info = "WNTRQ - Last, Roster First"
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey. 
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction.

title: As a User, I want to edit an existing Winter League Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN a player already has an existing Winter League Requests
custom_steps: WHEN user opens existing Winter League Requests
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit(grey) button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state. 
AND Clicking  Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save(grey) button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
AND Editable fields will match what is in the provided Data Discovery (Note the special behaviors)
AND A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values and reload the transaction in view mode. 
AND Required field and format checks will only be made if the transaction is in a post-Approval state.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.  
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification. See Messages #77.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
AND If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a BOC User, I want to create a new Winter League Request Transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks on any of the Create New Icon > Minor League > Assignments > Winter League Request
OR Create New Icon > Major League > Assignments > Winter League Request
custom_expected:
THEN system will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary Request for the same player 
AND If a preliminary transaction already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction.
OR If no preliminary transaction already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND The status of preliminary will display in red on the form in view and edit mode
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a BOC user, I want to submit a Winter League Request to Club from WLR form
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in to submit a Winter League request to club
custom_steps: WHEN BOC has the preliminary form in edit mode or view mode.
custom_expected:
THEN Submit to Club button will be available on the form.The button is blue. 
AND Clicking Submit to Club will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. (Global error messaging, modal, pinned errors, red highlight for missing required fields)
AND Clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND After the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Pending to Club"  
AND The status "Pending to Club" appears in green on the form in view and edit mode.
AND System reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful approve blue notification. Messages #76.
AND No entry is added to the player's player history.  
AND An Approval item should be generated for BOC Users
AND An Action Item should be generated for Club Users 

NOTE: This is not a standard transaction and should not be subject to the standard rule checks (similar to DL Recertifications)

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to Submit a Winter League Request From Requests screen
custom_preconds:
NOTE: this was copied from an AL story, only included for integration testing purposes
GIVEN a BOC user with permission to edit  winter league requests is logged in
AND one or more requests have been submitted to BOC from WLP (https://winterleaguesdev.mlb.com/wlp/#/requests)
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Requests screen
custom_expected:
THEN user should  see a dropdown menu next to requests with a status of "Pending"
AND clicking the dropdown should allow them to select "Submit"
AND selecting "Submit" should update the Request's status to "Submitted" and trigger a blue notification "Request submitted"
AND this state change should be what triggers the auto-creation and submission to Club of a Winter League Request for the relevant player
AND the Winter League Request should appear on the relevant Org's Action Items
AND the Winter League Request should be able to be completed as normal in ebis by the Org

title: As a User, I want to view a player's Winter League Request History on their profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in Professional Players profile
custom_steps: WHEN user is in "Waivers and Trans" Tab
custom_expected:
THEN "Winter League Request History" will be displayed on the last collapsible section. 
AND it will be expanded by default.
AND Inside the section will be a widget that matches the provided wireframe and data discovery. http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/waivers___transactions.html
AND Pending requests should appear in green
OR If no Winter League Requests exist for the player the section header still going to display but there won't be any table (including the table headers).

title: As a User, I want to Grant a Winter League Request Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Winter League Request is in pending state
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing or Editing the request
custom_expected:
THEN Grant button will be available.
AND User can click Grant button
AND Transaction Status updates to Approved
AND Decision updates to Granted
AND All other pending requests for the player will be automatically denied when the request is granted
AND If the request was in edit mode, the page will refresh in view mode
OR If the request was in view mode, the page will refresh in view mode
AND Will receive a blue notification message: "The Winter League Request has been granted."
AND When request is granted, "Agreement Reached" and checkbox will appear on the request
AND BOC Users receive a Notification when Request is Granted
Or Club Users receive a Notification when Request is Granted

title: As a User, I want to Deny a Winter League Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Winter League Request is in pending state
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing or Editing the request
custom_expected:
THEN Deny(grey) button will be available in both View and Edit mode.
AND User can click Deny button
AND Transaction Status updates to Approved
AND Decision updates to Denied
AND No other request is modified as a result of denying this request
AND If the request was in edit mode, the page will refresh in view mode
OR If the request was in view mode, the page will refresh in view mode
AND Will receive a blue notification message: "The Winter League Request has been denied."
AND BOC Users receive a Notification when Request is Denied
AND Club Users receive a Notification when Request is Denied

title: As a BOC User, I want to delete a Winter League Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user has edit permission for the Winter League Request form in Preliminary and Pending to Club states
custom_steps: WHEN the form is in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should a "Delete" button on the form in grey
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this Winter League Request?
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken. 
AND Deleted transactions should not appear on the front end or be searchable.
AND Any Approval Items or Action Items related to the deleted Request should be deleted as well

title: As a BOC user, I want to be able to reverse or reverse and suppress a Winter League Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC logs in
AND Winter League Request is in Approved state
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the transaction in View or Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN "Reverse" button will be available in grey
AND Successful reverse notification will be displayed. See Messages #79
AND The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND If the Request was originally Granted, the decision on the Request is updated to be Denied.
OR If the Request was originally Denied, the decision on the Request is updated to be Granted.
AND BOC Admins will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. 
AND Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Winter League History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.

title: As a User, I want to receive an email when a Winter League Request is submitted to club
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Winter League Request in Preliminary state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Submit to Club
custom_expected:
THEN upon submitting to club, an email is sent to users defined in the Email Utility
 - Subject: Winter League Request
 - Body: A Winter League Request has been received on " + requestDate + " from club " + fromTeam + " of the " + winterLeague + " for player " + playerName + "."
AND Emails are generated whether the Request was created in ebis or the Winter League Portal

title: As a User, I want to receive an error if the Winter League Team has 10 pending requests
custom_preconds:
**NOTE: This rule should only count requests that were NOT created via import (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153837154)
EX: if a club has 10 pending requests from import, and only 8 that were created outside of import process, they should still be allowed to have 2 more pending requests created outside of import process**

GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Winter League Request for a player
AND the Winter League Team on the request already had 10 pending requests
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks submit to Club
custom_expected:
THEN system should check for existing requests from Winter League Team in "Pending to Club" status
AND if user finds 10 or more of these requests then system should display message:"Invalid Winter League Request.  <club> currently have <number pending requests> pending Winter League Requests."
AND Hint Text should say:"The maximum is 10."  
AND Clicking Back should return the user to the entry point
AND clicking Override should submit the request

title: Winter League Requests Permissions - BOC - Minor Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC admin or BOC basic user
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with Winter League Requests
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Admin users should be able to View, Create, Edit, Grant, Deny, Submit, Reverse, Delete and Search Winter League Requests
BUT BOC Basic Users should only be able to View and Search Winter League Requests

title: Winter League Requests Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as club basic or club admin user
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Winter League Request
custom_expected:
THEN Club Admin users should be able to  Grant, Deny, and  Update Winter League Requests
BUT Club Basic users should only be able to View and Search Winter League Requests

title: As a User, I want to search for Winter League Request Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Advance Search page
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "Winter League Request" under "Search Type"
custom_expected:
THEN "Decision" will be the filters under the Transaction search type
AND Filter will be a Select2
AND Possible Values will be "Granted" and "Denied"
AND Conducting an advanced search will return the standard result columns for a transaction search
AND "Decision" will be included in the result columns

title: As a User, I want to receive an error if the player has an Offseason Assignment
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Winter League Request for a player 
AND the player selected as an Offseason Assignment
custom_steps: WHEN user submits Winter League Request
custom_expected:
THEN if  the request is on or after 6/1, system should look for offseason assignments from 6/1 of current year to 5/31 of next year
BUT if request is before 6/1, system should look for offseason assignments from 6/1 of last year to 5/31 of current year
AND if an approved offseason assignment is found system should display message: "Invalid Winter League Request.  Player was assigned via an Offseason Assignment on <date> to play for <club>."

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Winter League Requests report
custom_preconds: GIVEN "Winter League Requests " is a report in the Report listing widget
custom_steps: WHEN user selects this report from the widget
custom_expected:
THEN system should launch the prompts according to the requirements
AND entering the desired prompts and running the report should work and match the requirements
AND the report should have an LDAP associated with it

title: As a BOC User, I want to be able to check "Agreements Reached" checkbox on WLR form in ebis
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a WLR for a player has been granted in ebis
AND BOC user is logged in with permission to edit WLRs
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the WLR in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to check "Agreements Reached" checkbox
AND user should be able to save the WLR with the checkbox checked

title: As a User, I want new Winter League Requests entered into the WLP to be sent to ebis
custom_preconds:
NOTE: This workflow changed with the implementation of the new WLP by AL team, steps and expected result have been changed from original NL story
GIVEN a RESTful interface for the Winter League Portal exists in EBIS
custom_steps: WHEN a new Request is created in the WLP
custom_expected:
THEN the request should show up for BOC on the WLP - Requests page (under International from leftnav) as "Pending"
AND there should be a split button next to the player on the WLP Request page that allows BOC user to select "Submit" or "Cancel"
AND clicking "Submit" should submit the WLR to club and all Pending to Club updates should be made as if the WLR was Submitted to Club from the form itself
BUT clicking Cancel should cancel the WLR and it should also update to Cancelled in WLP

title: As a User, I want the cancellation of Requests in the WLP sent back to EBIS
custom_preconds: GIVEN a RESTful interface exists in EBIS for cancelling a Winter League Request in the Winter League Portal
custom_steps: WHEN a Winter League Request is cancelled in in the WLP
custom_expected:
THEN fields passed in should match the fields passed in for a new request
AND the fields passed in should be:
-- ebisID (player ID)
-- Requesting Team (ebis club ID)
-- Request Date
AND system should find pending to club requests that match the passed in data
AND these requests in EBIS should be deleted
AND system should return a generic JSON object to WLP with a boolean indicating success/failure as well as a list of error messages

title: As a User, I want the granting of Requests sent back to the WLP
custom_preconds:
GIVEN RESTful service between EBIS and WLP for granting requests
AND a WLR has been submitted from the WLP to a Major League club
custom_steps: WHEN a Request is granted in EBIS (either by MJ Club or by BOC on behalf of MJ Club)
custom_expected:
THEN the WLR should be updated to In Negotiation on BOC WLP - Requests page
AND the WLR should be updated to In Negotiation in WLP for the requesting winter league club user

title: As a User, I want the denying of Requests sent back to the WLP
custom_preconds:
GIVEN RESTful service between EBIS and WLP for denying requests
AND a WLR has been submitted from the WLP to a Major League club
custom_steps: WHEN a Request is denied in EBIS (either by MJ Club or by BOC on behalf of MJ Club)
custom_expected:
THEN the WLR should be updated to Denied on BOC WLP - Requests page
AND the WLR should be updated to Denied in WLP for the requesting winter league club user

title: As a User, I want to receive an email notification if communication to the WLP fails
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is attempting to perform an action in EBIS that will send data to Winter League Portal (grant, deny, agreement reached checkbox, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN player or Winter League Request information fails to be sent to the WLP because of an error with the data or file
custom_expected:
THEN  an email should be generated detailing the piece of information that failed, along with the Player ID associated with the information and the reason for failure
AND email should be sent to all addresses on the email list (this does NOT use the Email Utility in EBIS)
**NOTE: COORDINATION WITH DEV TEAM REQUIRED, CANNOT BE TESTED VIA FRONT END**

title: As a User, I want attempts to communicate information to the WLP that fail to not be lost forever
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is attempting to take an action in EBIS that will send data to the Winter League Portal (grant, deny, agreement reached checkbox etc)
custom_steps: WHEN the attempt to send information or files to WLP fails because of an inability to establish a connection between the two systems
custom_expected:
THEN the system should queue the items to be sent and continue to try at regular intervals until the system can successfully transmit the information
AND if after a pre-determined amount of time the system can still not communicate the information to the WLP, then the system should cease efforts and send a failure email, per [C1145730]
AND if all retries failed, system should preserve the call semantics in a table so that a batch can be used to later diagnose and/or retry through a batch service
**NOTE: COORDINATION WITH DEV TEAM REQUIRED, CANNOT BE TESTED VIA FRONT END**
